item.title: Accessing a self-hosted website from the local network (hairpin)
item.description: Explanation: In this case we are trying to redirect a website request, to a machine in the local [[3-sysnet/2-network/Network-MoC|Network]] which hosts the website over the local network accesible through its domain name.

item.title: Build and Install PHP 8.0 for Ubuntu 18.04
item.description: This is an annex to this article: https://computingforgeeks.com/install-php-8-7-on-ubuntu-18-bionic-beaver/?expand_article=1 Mirror: https://web.archive.org/web/20230802211119/https://computingforgeeks.com/install-php-8-7-on-ubuntu-18-bionic-beaver/?expand_article=1 The article is a guide on how to install PHP 8.

item.title: Change display name of a user (ubuntu)
item.description: Ubuntu is a [[3-sysnet/1-linux/Linux-MoC|Linux]] distribution Sudo Command 1 sudo usermod -c "New Display Name" username Explanation usermod: This is the main command.

item.title: Disable App Menu in Ubuntu 22.04
item.description: Ubuntu is a [[3-sysnet/1-linux/Linux-MoC|Linux]] distribution. Use the command 1 gsettings set org.gnome.shell.extensions.dash-to-dock show-show-apps-button false Explanation gsettings: This is the command-line tool used in Ubuntu (and other GNOME-based systems) to interact with the Dconf settings database.

item.title: En las montanas de la locura
Hierba - Keum Suk Gendry Kim
item.description: La historia plasmada en “Hierba” puede describirse, en pocas palabras, como abrumadoramente desgarradora. Resulta dif铆cil incluso para el personaje de Keum Suk Gendry asimilar la crueldad a la que las j贸venes coreanas y chinas fueron sometidas desde una edad temprana durante el intento de colonizaci贸n japon茅s.

item.title: Preserve Bash History from Multiple Terminal Windows (Linux)
item.description: “In this tutorial, we studied ways to preserve Bash history in multiple terminal windows on [[3-sysnet/1-linux/Linux-MoC|Linux]] . In the beginning, we discussed the history feature of the Bash shell and its default behavior.

item.title: Remove access to the terminal to certain user (Ubuntu 22.04)
item.description: Ubuntu is a [[3-sysnet/1-linux/Linux-MoC|Linux]] distribution. Use the command 1 sudo usermod --shell /bin/false username Explanation sudo: execute a command as another user usermod: modify a user account --shell /bin/false :The name of the user’s new login shell.

item.title: Zip all files including hidden in Linux
item.description: Objective To compress an entire folder and files inside including hidden on [[3-sysnet/1-linux/Linux-MoC|Linux]], recursively. Command You can use the tar command to create a compressed archive of all files and folders in a directory, including hidden files and folders, recursively.
